statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: With a crucial road trip looming, Allen Iverson made sure the Philadelphia 76ers left home on a winning note.
article.headline: Iverson involves teammates, earns Brown's praise
article.linkText: Sixers beat Hawks, head West on winning note
article.story:
PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Allen Iverson had little choice but to pass the ball. Larry Brown had wanted him to, and the Atlanta Hawks forced his hand.
Iverson

Iverson scored 12 of his 24 points in the third quarter and had seven assists to lead the Philadelphia 76ers to a 94-83 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Friday night. One day after coach Larry Brown criticized Iverson's shot selection and expressed displeasure that the star guard didn't practice Thursday because of a sore elbow, the NBA's MVP played just like his coach wants. Iverson didn't rush his shots, passed the ball more and got his teammates involved in the game. The Sixers had five players reach double figures, and Eric Snow had nine points. "I was just taking what they were giving me," Iverson said. Iverson, averaging 27 shots per game, took just seven shots and had five of his seven assists in the first half. "They were triple-teaming him," Brown said. "Any time he got out on the wing, they sent another guy over. He got rid of it quickly. He did a great job." Jason Terry scored 22 and reserve Mark Strickland had 17 for Atlanta, which has lost three straight after winning three in a row. Shareef Abdur-Rahim had just six points on 2-for-9 shooting. The defending Eastern Conference champions, who had lost eight of 10, begin their toughest stretch of the season Tuesday when they start a seven-game road trip against the Western Conference. "I'm not even going to look at that," said Derrick Coleman, who had 16 points and 11 rebounds despite feeling sick before the game. After the Hawks cut it to 56-51 early in the third, Iverson took over, nailing three consecutive 3-pointers. He hit a 3-pointer from the left baseline and one from the left wing that made it 62-52. Nazr Mohammed made a free throw for Atlanta, then Iverson drilled a 3-pointer from the top of the circle, giving the Sixers a 65-52 lead. Aaron McKie hit a 3-pointer, and Iverson capped a 17-1 run with a driving layup as the Sixers built a 73-52 lead. Atlanta didn't get closer than 10 the rest of the way. "He's so quick, it's hard to contain him," Strickland said of Iverson. "When we doubled him, he got hot from the outside." Dikembe Mutombo had 11 points and 12 rebounds, McKie scored 17 points, and Matt Harpring added 12. The Hawks trailed by 20 early in the second quarter, but cut it to five by outscoring the Sixers 26-9 before Harpring hit a 17-footer that put Philadelphia ahead 50-43 at halftime. Former Sixers Toni Kukoc and Mohammed, both traded to Atlanta in the deal for Mutombo, weren't factors. Kukoc missed all seven of his shots, and Mohammed had four points on 1-for-6 shooting. "They are experienced. They teased us a little, then turned it up," Hawks coach Lon Kruger said. "They got off to an explosive start and we were trying to fight back all night. We just couldn't get over the hump."

Game notes
Atlanta is 3-12 on the road. The Hawks snapped a 21-game road losing streak last month. ... Sixers guard Speedy Claxton was eligible to come off the injured list, but probably won't be activated until Tuesday's game against the Lakers. ... Abdur-Rahim got a technical foul in the third after being called for a foul on Mutombo. Kruger got his first of the season seconds later. ... Hawks guard Emanuel Davis didn't play because of postconcussion syndrome. ... Philadelphia's 35 points in the first quarter were its most in any quarter this year. ... The Sixers outrebounded Atlanta, 49-35.
